conclusion: The problem involves calculating the magnitude of the induced electromotive force (EMF) in a rectangular coil rotating in a uniform magnetic field.

The formula for the induced EMF in a rotating coil is given by: \( \mathcal{E} = n B A \omega \sin(\omega t) \), where \( n \) is the number of turns, \( B \) is the magnetic induction intensity, \( A \) is the area of the coil, \( \omega \) is the angular velocity, and \( t \) is the time.
The area \( A \) of the rectangular coil is calculated as \( A = l_{AB} \cdot l_{BC} \), where \( l_{AB} \) and \( l_{BC} \) are the side lengths of the rectangle.
The rectangular coil has side lengths \( l_{AB} = 0.2 \mathrm{m} \) and \( l_{BC} = 0.5 \mathrm{m} \).

premise: The formula for the area of a rectangle is \( A = l_{AB} \cdot l_{BC} \), and the side lengths are \( l_{AB} = 0.2 \mathrm{m} \) and \( l_{BC} = 0.5 \mathrm{m} \).
conclusion: The area of the rectangular coil is \( A = 0.2 \mathrm{m} \times 0.5 \mathrm{m} = 0.1 \mathrm{m}^2 \).
The magnetic induction intensity \( B \) is given as \( 0.1 \mathrm{T} \), the number of turns \( n \) is 100, and the angular velocity \( \omega \) is \( 100\pi \mathrm{rad/s} \).

premise: The formula for the maximum induced EMF is \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{max}} = n B A \omega \), and the values are \( n = 100 \), \( B = 0.1 \mathrm{T} \), \( A = 0.1 \mathrm{m}^2 \), and \( \omega = 100\pi \mathrm{rad/s} \).
The formula for the induced EMF as a function of time is \( \mathcal{E} = n B A \omega \sin(\omega t) \), and the maximum value of \( \mathcal{E} \) is \( 10\pi \mathrm{V} \).
conclusion: The magnitude of the induced electromotive force in the coil is \( \mathcal{E} = 314\sin(100\pi t) \mathrm{V} \).
